all_questions.question: What is the sequence of processes used by the system?
all_questions.context: And that sequence says that first translate, then generate, then translate, and then generate to arrive at the final thing.

all_questions.question: Why does the system use plural in some cases?
all_questions.context: And it is not indicated here in the picture. But these translation options, these candidates are actually obviously scored. They have some score associated with them and they are sorted according to the score.

all_questions.question: What is unique about the final step of the generation step?
all_questions.context: So this has the capacity to produce a word form which was never accessible to the, to the, to the, to the parallel data or was never seen in the parallel data.

all_questions.question: What is the purpose of using a product of two tables in this system?
all_questions.context: And instead of having one table which lists the word forms in source language and target language, you have now two separate tables. One that lists all the translations of lemmas to lemmas and that's shorter. And you have another separate table which maps source text to the target text.

all_questions.question: What happens if the order of joining tables is incorrect?
all_questions.context: if your data is, uh, not the way that you think, uh, uh, what happens is that you will generate too many candidates in one of these stages. You will have to prune them to, to keep them in the memory, uh, but you're pruning them without any contact. and you will lose the good ones.
